content: Please confirm that you want to delete your {{productName}}.

comment.text: This translation key is used to display a title in a confirmation dialog that asks users to delete their product. It appears when deleting an account or removing a product from the portal, prompting users to confirm the action.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation "يرجى تأكيد رغبتك في حذف {{productName}} الخاص بك." translates to 'Please confirm your desire to delete your {{productName}}'. A more natural and common phrasing for a confirmation prompt would be 'Please confirm that you want to delete your {{productName}}'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: يرجى التأكد من رغبتك في حذف {{productName}}.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'Lütfən, {{productName}}-i silmək istədiyinizi təsdiqləyin.' is a literal translation and sounds slightly unnatural in Azerbaijani. A more natural phrasing would be closer to 'Zəhmət təşkil edin, {{productName}}-i silmək istədiyinizi təsdiq edin.' or 'Xahiş edirəm, {{productName}}-i silmək istədiyinizi təsdiq edin.'
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Xahiş edirəm, {{productName}}-i silmək istədiyinizi təsdiq edin.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word 'prostor' (space) doesn't accurately translate 'your {{productName}}'. 'Prostor' implies a shared or allocated space, whereas the English suggests ownership.
The Finnish translation includes an unnecessary space before the variable {{productName}}.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Ole hyvä ja vahvista, että haluat poistaa {{productName}} -si.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While technically correct, 'Ole hyvä ja vahvista' is a bit formal and verbose for this context.  A more natural and conversational phrasing would improve the user experience.

The translation "{{productName}}を削除することをご確認ください。" is technically correct but a bit formal and indirect for a confirmation prompt. A more natural phrasing would be closer to "{{productName}}を削除しますか？" or "{{productName}}を削除してよろしいですか？"
The word 'spaţiul' (space) doesn't accurately translate 'your'. It should convey ownership.
The translation includes a space before the {{productName}} placeholder. This could cause formatting issues in the UI.

The translation 'ඔබගේ {{productName}} මැකීමට වුවමනා බව කරුණාකර තහවුරු කරන්න.' while conveying the general meaning, is a bit formal and lengthy for a confirmation prompt.  A more natural and concise phrasing would improve user experience.

The word 'මැකීමට' (makimik) literally translates to 'to erase'. While understood, 'ඉවත් කිරීමට' (ivathimikaru) - 'to remove' - is a more common and appropriate term for deleting a product in this context.

The phrase 'කරුණාකර තහවුරු කරන්න' (karunakarathahawuru karann) translates to 'please confirm'. A shorter and more common alternative is 'අනුමැතිය දෙන්න' (anumathiya denna) which means 'give approval'.

The translation 'Potrdi, če želiš izbrisati svoj {{productName}}' is not the most natural or accurate translation of 'Please confirm that you want to delete your {{productName}}'. A better option would be 'Potrdite, da želite izbrisati svoj {{productName}}'. The original uses 'Please confirm', which should be translated to a more formal 'Potrdite' rather than the informal 'Potrdi'.
The sentence structure is slightly awkward. Although grammatically correct, a more fluent phrasing would improve readability.
The word 'xóa' should be 'xóa bỏ' for a more natural and complete expression in Vietnamese when referring to deletion.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Xin vui lòng xác nhận rằng bạn muốn xóa bỏ {{productName}} của mình.
